metadata.title: CVE-2023-43786 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
A vulnerability was found in libX11 due to an infinite loop within thePutSubImage() function. This flaw allows a local user to consume allavailable system resources and cause a denial of service condition.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-43786` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libx11-6 - 2:1.6.4-3ubuntu0.4+esm2
libx11-data - 2:1.6.4-3ubuntu0.4+esm2
libx11-xcb1 - 2:1.6.4-3ubuntu0.4+esm2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

libxpm4 - 1:3.5.12-1ubuntu0.18.04.2+esm1
xpmutils - 1:3.5.12-1ubuntu0.18.04.2+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: libx11 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:1.6.4-3ubuntu0.4+esm2').
libxpm package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:3.5.12-1ubuntu0.18.04.2+esm1').
motif package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
